provenance.name: Philadelphia Museum of Art
provenance.note: Acquired, and probably commissioned, from Blake by Thomas Butts, c. 1799-1800; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; offered from his collection, Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 72 (not sold); the dealer Francis Harvey by 1865 when offered in a catalogue for £6.6s.; William Bell Scott by 1865; sold from his collection, Sotheby's, 14 July 1892, lot 237 (£40 to Sidney Morse); sold from the Morse collection, Christie's, 26 July 1929, lot 37 (£1029 to the dealer Gabriel Wells); acquired April 1938 from Wells by the dealer Charles Sessler for $4050 and sold by Sessler Dec. 1938 to Mrs. Willaim T. Tonner ($4500); bequeathed by Tonner to the Philadelphia Museum of Art in 1964 and received by the museum in 1972.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The design represents the birth of Christ, Luke 2:6-7. The scene takes place in a darkened stable, with visible roof beams made of wood. Straw covers the floor. Slightly to the left of center Jesus Christ hovers as a nude male infant. He has short hair and is surrounded by a glowing aura. His arms are raised horizontally with his palms up and his left leg bent slightly. Overall, his position recalls that of crucifixion. His mouth may be slightly open as he looks at the figure to the right. The baby Christ faces forward and slightly right. To the left of center kneels the Virgin Mary. She wears a long gown and her long, slightly curly hair cascades over her shoulders. Both feet are visible beneath the hem of her skirt and her right arm hangs at her side. Her head is bent back and her eyes are closed, almost as though she has fainted. Mary is supported by Joseph, the man standing behind her. He faces to the right with his head turned partly toward the viewer. He has curly hair and a beard. He wears a long gown with his right foot visible beneath the hem. His right leg is bent and his right arm is at his side and bent, as he leans forward to support Mary. To the right of center sits a woman with her legs bent, perhaps underneath her. This is St. Elizabeth, the mother of John the Baptist. She wears a long gown and a veil or scarf covers her hair. She faces to the left and looks at the baby Christ, both arms horizontal and hands outstretched, reaching toward Christ. Her mouth is open as she looks at Christ with an expression of awe. On Elizabeth's lap sits John the Baptist, a nude male child with short, curly hair. His legs are bent slightly and his arms are at his side but bent upward, with his hands to his mouth. His hands may be together in prayer. He faces left and may be looking at Jesus or at the Virgin Mary. On the right side of the image stand two cows or oxen, facing left and down. Each animal is horned. They appear to be eating from a wooden manger full of straw. At the top center of the image is a square window, which looks out onto the night sky and a radiance that may represent the star of Bethlehem.

component.illusobjdesc: The scene takes place in a darkened stable, with visible roof beams made of wood. Straw covers the floor.

Slightly to the left of center Jesus Christ hovers as a nude male infant. He has short hair and is surrounded by a glowing aura. His arms are raised horizontally with his palms up and his left leg bent slightly. Overall, his position recalls that of crucifixion. His mouth may be slightly open as he looks at the figure to his right. The baby Christ faces forward and slightly right.

The Virgin Mary kneels left of center. She wears a long gown and her long, slightly curly hair cascades over her shoulders. Both feet are visible beneath the hem of her skirt and her right arm hangs at her side. Her head is bent back and her eyes are closed, almost as though she has fainted. Mary is supported by Joseph, the man behind her. She faces to the right and slightly forward.

Joseph stands on the left behind the Virgin Mary. He has short, curly hair and a beard. He wears a long gown with his right foot visible beneath the hem. His right leg is bent and his right arm is at his side and bent, as he leans forward to support Mary, who appears to be fainting. He faces right but looks down at Mary with an expression of concern on his face.

To the right of center sits a woman with her legs bent, perhaps underneath her. This is St. Elizabeth, the mother of John the Baptist. She wears a long gown and a head veil or scarf covers her hair. She faces to the left and looks at the baby Christ, his both arms horizontal and hands outstretched, reaching toward Christ. Her mouth is open as she looks at Christ with an expression of awe.

On the lap of the woman reaching toward Christ sits a nude male child with short, curly hair. This is John the Baptist. His legs are bent slightly and his arms are at his side but bent upward, with his hands to his mouth. His hands may be together in prayer. He faces left and may be looking at Jesus or at the Virgin Mary.
On the right side of the image stand two cows or oxen, facing left and down. Each animal is horned. They appear to be eating from a wooden manger full of straw.
The cows or oxen appear to be eating from a wooden manger full of straw.

At the top center of the image is a square window, which looks out onto the night sky and a radiance that likely represents the star of Bethlehem. The window frame is probably made of wood with what may be the head of a nail in its lower left corner.
